intro: Bladhia chinensis var. minor, commonly known as the Chinese bladdernut, is a deciduous shrub native to eastern Asia. It belongs to the Hippocastanaceae family and is characterized by its compound leaves and distinctive seed pods. The plant typically grows to a height of 2–5 meters and thrives in well-drained, loamy soils. Its flowers are yellow and inconspicuous, while the showy, inflated seed pods are a notable feature. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has historical uses in traditional medicine.
